name: coving
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a long, curved piece of wood, plaster (= a smooth building material that becomes hard when it dries), etc. placed as a decoration along the edge at the top of a wall where it joins the ceiling: The contrasting colour really shows off the coving on the ceiling. We have a Victorian house with ornate plaster coving and ceiling roses in the downstairs rooms. Synonyms
cove
cove mouldingRelated word
coved
More examplesFewer examplesOur house still has original coving, original doors, balustrades and picture rails.The houses are traditional in design, with ceiling coving, open fireplaces and bay windows.The lounge has kept its coving and ornamental mantelpiece.A heraldic coat of arms is set into the ceiling, surrounded by decorative Victorian coving.
